meanings.definition: To challenge or provoke someone to do something
meanings.sent1: She defi her friend to a race.
meanings.sent2: He defi his fear of heights by climbing the tall tree.
meanings.sent3: The siblings defi each other to see who could eat the most ice cream.
meanings.sent4: The student defi the odds and aced the difficult exam.
meanings.sent5: The coach defi the team to push themselves harder during practice.

meanings.definition: To resist or fight against something
meanings.sent1: The hero defi the villain's evil plans.
meanings.sent2: The immune system defi the virus and kept the body healthy.
meanings.sent3: The cat defi taking a bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: The protesters defi the unjust law by marching in the streets.
meanings.sent5: The soldier defi the enemy's attack with bravery and determination.

meanings.definition: A formal declaration or statement of intention to do something
meanings.sent1: She wrote a defi to start her own business.
meanings.sent2: The company issued a defi to increase sales by 20%.
meanings.sent3: The invitation was a defi to attend the grand opening.
meanings.sent4: The contract served as a defi to complete the project on time.
meanings.sent5: The announcement was a defi to launch a new product line.
